citation.article-title: Jeotgalibacillus alimentarius gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel bacterium isolated from jeotgal with L-lysine in the cell wall, and reclassification of Bacillus marinus Rüger 1983 . as Marinibacillus marinus gen nov., comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Marinibacillus (Ma.ri.ni.ba.cil'lus. L. adj. marinus of the sea; Gr. n. baktron rod; M.L. masc. n. Marinibacillus rod of the sea)
The description is the same as that given by Rüger (1983) and Rüger et al. (2000).

Additional chemotaxonomic characters found in this study are as follows: cell wall peptidoglycan contains L-lysine at position 3 of the peptide subunit; the predominant menaquinone is MK-7; and the major fatty acid is anteiso-C15:0.
